main_definition: GTK stands for GNOME Toolkit, a set of libraries used to build graphical user interfaces in Linux-based systems.

meanings_and_examples.example: An application using GTK for its GUI development, like GNOME Shell or Evolution email client.
The use of GTK in the Linux distribution called Elementary OS which provides a customizable and sleek interface to users.
Using GTK to develop applications that can run on various platforms, such as GNOME Shell extension for adding new functionalities.
